title: [SOLVED] 820-3332 no picture
message: I have an 820-3332 that sometimes has no picture. when theres no picture I have a 27ohm short to ground on ppvcore_gpu, what are the odds its something on that line other than the gpu being dead? this computer has never had liquid damage either.

title: [SOLVED] 820-3332 no picture
message: Touched up soldering joints on U8900? I’d bet that’s the problem and 27 ohms is not a short btw.

title: [SOLVED] 820-3332 no picture
message:
go to any ohms law calculator, type in 1 volt, then 27 ohms. what power output in wattage does it give you?

how many watts do you expect a modern powerful GPU to take?

now tell me why it isn't a short.

follow the instructions here to solve the problem [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lumJ0cN5oyY[/url]

title: [SOLVED] 820-3332 no picture
message: wow that was pretty sad, i didnt even realize that this was the board louis talked about in his video until after you said that. The joints on that chip looked terrible; I touched them up and it appears to be working fine. thanks for the help
